intro: Malva parviflora subsp. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited mallows, is a herbaceous perennial native to the Mediterranean region. It features hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruit is a capsule containing numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
